meanings.sent1: The chef accidentally overcured the steak, making it tough and dry.
meanings.sent2: She always overcured her cookies, resulting in burnt bottoms.
meanings.sent3: The sun overcured my skin, turning me into a lobster!
meanings.sent4: His perfectionism overcured the project, making it lose its natural charm.
meanings.sent5: The overcured meat was inedible, resembling shoe leather more than dinner.

meanings.sent1: The overcured wood was brittle and prone to splintering.
meanings.sent2: The overcured ham had a strong, almost bitter taste.
meanings.sent3: The overcured leather jacket was stiff and uncomfortable to wear.
meanings.sent4: Her overcured hair looked dry and damaged from too many treatments.
meanings.sent5: The overcured paint on the walls was cracking and peeling, needing a fresh coat.
